resources.string: "No Context Robot"
"BACK"
"NEXT"

"Mankind is destructive. Despite the advances in science to cure diseases and live in endless abundance, humans inherently cannot accept a Utopia. Instead, they inevitably revert back to their own undoing. The last war, simply known as \'The End\', destroyed all organic matter."

"However, humans were not without their moments of brilliance. For example, they built you, their most advanced robot yet, the \'Autonomous Super Savior\' with the ability to \'Space Hop In Time\'. You are mankind\’s last hope... ummm... what is your name?"
"Clockwork"
"Hal"
"Dex"
"I am fully autonomous. I choose my own name!"

"You\’ve been designed to teleport back in time to key events that will shape humanity’s future. With the push of a button, you will warp through the space time continuum to an exact time and location that holds great potential for historical significance. However, before you were fully completed, war wiped away your creators. The missing piece in your programming is the contextual background of why you were teleported back and what you should do."

"Instead you must rely on your Autonomous Super Savior circuitry to decide the best course of action. Will you use your binary logical reasoning or trust your emoticons? Will you decide to be a pacifist or will you regularly fire your lasers of doom? Got it? Good! Here we gooo! Beep beep boop poop boop wheee!"
"Life began in a small town, but society never quite made sense. People seemed to be in a constant state of urgency for rather dull affairs. Instead, you found comfort in nature."
"As soon as you were able, you picked up a bow and a quiver of arrows before leaving for the Unending Forest. Your marksmen skills are known across the kingdom."
"Scenes of life are hazy at best. Any attempts to recollect memories are rewarded with a splitting headache."
"Events seem to overlap and uncertainty clouds your thoughts. One image paints an older, weary looking version of you laying in a pool of blood."
"As you try to piece together memories, you wonder if the image is a father you never knew."
"Answer Choice AB Answer 3"
"Answer Choice AB Answer 4"

"Early tests of time travel proved to be rather problematic for living entities. Lab rats and monkeys all shared the common characteristics of violently exploding upon reformation at the destination. Contrary to the beliefs of humanity’s top scientists, bubble wrap and styrofoam was not enough to ensure safe transportation."

"Unlike your tissued counterpart, this is of no concern because you were built with a reinforced titanium shell. If you had the capacity to worry, then things like fuel levels, the occasional fried circuit, and failing your mission would be your greatest concerns."
"Speaking of the mission, you blink into existence some 200 million years into the past and find yourself surrounded in a lush rainforest. What do you do now?"
"Do a self systems diagnostics check"
"No time to lose, I hurry to my destination"
"I need to find a new fuel source"

"Great idea! Traveling across time may have caused parts to move around inadvertently. While your system diagnostics are running, you look through your arsenal of weaponry. Lasers of Doom, check. Mechanical Killer Buzzsaw, check."

"Beep Beep Boop Beep. The pattern of sounds indicates that all is well, although you are slightly low on fuel. Surprisingly, the most complex algorithms for time travel still has trouble adjusting for daylight savings and different time zones."
"You arrived an hour early. What do you do now?"
"No time to lose, I hurry to my destination"
"I need to find a new fuel source"
"You are about to affect the first event that will influence the fate of humanity. No pressure."

"In movies and literature, time travel is depicted as a fragile thing. In reality, it\’s really quite the opposite. You see, most lives are uneventful. Living creatures fall into a daily routine with minor deviations. As a whole, the world wouldn’t notice whether these \’lives\’ existed or not. Instead, only certain creatures make a dramatic impact on the world and often it\’s by sheer coincidence. You wonder how this event will shape the world."
"You reach your destination and attempt to find the target. Upon closer examination, you see a butterfly struggling to emerge out of its cocoon. Unsure of the relevance, you decide to..."
"Help the butterfly emerge"
"Leave the butterfly alone"
"Crush the butterfly with my cold robotic hands"
"The \‘Low Fuel\’ warning beeps, catching your undivided attention. Time travel is exhausting and you need to refuel or risk the chance of powering down."

"While you are unable to renew your plutonium power source, you do have the ability to mimic the creation of fossil fuels. Usually the process is natural and requires the decomposition of buried dead organisms for millions of years. Since you are the pinnacle of human technology, you simply crush creatures into the complex machine sitting inside your stomach, which then applies pressure, heat, and reorganizes the matter until it becomes robo-grade usable."
"Whether by coincidence or a brilliantly planned time warp, you find the perfect specimen walking by, the humblest of God’s creatures, the Tyrannosaurus Rex."
"Devour the T-Rex for breakfast"
"Leave the T-Rex alone"
"Test "
"Test "
"Test "
"Test "
"Test "
"Test "
Hello world!
